result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua P. Braithwaite was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery by Prisoners [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
*   Pay costs of legal representation or Advocate Counsel fees for the defense of the case, to be determined within 45 days - PD - Doug Bihler.
*   Pay restitution in the sum of $3840.56 plus surcharges.
May not have contact with Correctional Officer.  The Dept shall promptly notify the Court of any new arrest or criminal charge made against the deft.

records.addlTxt: Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  DA Zapf appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Bihler.  Case is resolved.  Victim rights compliance.  Deft pleads guilty to the charge; found guilty by the Court.  Admits to repeater.  Sentencing arguments made.  Deft stipulates to the restitution in the amount of $3,840.56.  Deft sentenced to 10 yrs WSP concurrent to 12CF867; initial confinement of 7yrs followed by 3yrs of ES.  See ES conditions.  Appeal rights.  Atty Bihler will calculate the credit and submit to the court for approval.

records.addlTxt: Against Br 7.  Tab pulled for Br 3.

115pm
  Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Gouglas Bihler.  Clerk LE.  Substitution of Br 7 filed.  Tab pulled for Br 3.  Referred to Br 3 for further dispo on 2/6/15 @ 10:20am FPT.  Jury selection 2/23/15 @ 900am.  Info filed previously.  Not guilty plea entered.  Bond Continued.
copy of Letter from Atty Zapf to Atty Bihler
Defendant's Prior Record - filed by DA Robert Zapf

District Attorney Robert Zapf appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. Douglas Bihler. Clerk LE. KSD Corr. Off. Nathan Knautz sworn in and testified on behalf of the State. Cross-examination by Atty. Bihler. Probable cause found. Atty. Bihler requests adjournment for arraignment, as his client would like to request substitution of Judge Wilk. Arraignment on 11-18-14 @ 1:00pm. Bond continued.

204 p.m.  Atty Jerrold Hinshaw appeared as Special Prosecutor for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney D Bihler.  Clk  LE.  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; set before Commissioner on  11/13/14 @ 10 a.m.  Time limits tolled at request of deft.  Bond - continued.
From Atty Bihler - retained.
Atty:  D Bihler.

District Attorney Robert Zapf appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. Aileen Henry. Clerk LE. Case was scheduled for preliminary hearing this morning. Atty. Henry moves to withdraw as counsel. State opposes withdrawal. Court grants motion. Time limits tolled at the request of def. SPD's Office to appoint new attorney. Attorney status on 10-31-14 @ 1:00pm. Bond continued.
Atty:  A Henry.
